data.title: Great friendly spot
data.text: A group of girlfriends met here for lunch today. The restaurant was very cozy and friendly. We all enjoyed our meals. We sat for a long time enjoying and visiting and we never felt rushed.

data.title: Great food and location with outdoor seating on Main St!
data.text: Excellent choice for lunch.  Beautiful day sat outside to people watch and enjoyed a delicious meal!  Had Cajun Chicken Risotto, which was spicy and perfect!  A fantastic location with great food and service!

data.title: True Italian Cuisine!!
data.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant. We chose to eat inside (patio was offered). The menu had MANY delicious choices. We decided to take the half portion selection...salad and pasta. My husband had the green salads (great size portion) and spaghetti and meatball. You could tell it was home made!! I had the Caesar salad...best I have ever had...not too much dressing and garnished with shaved Parmesan cheese!! So yummy! And the best part (other than our wonderful server!!!) we got a bottle of vino for $25!!! We will definitely return and enjoy a new dish or two!!

data.title: Consistently Good to Very Good
data.text: Reasonable prices and good food.  Nice place for date night without breaking the bank.  Outdoor seating is great for people watching on Main Street.

data.title: ALWAYS RELIABLY GREAT ITALIAN FOOD
data.text: Every visit, we go here for lunch -- always reliably great Italian food. Lunch time has bargains too.

data.title: Trout
data.text: Great food and service at dinner. Outside tables or inside seating. Reasonable price. Downtown Pleasanton.

data.title: Classic neighborhood Italian restaurant
data.text:
We love Strizzi's for a couples night out, for a family celebration, for dinner out with a group of friends.  A good range of choices - from early specials, half-portion combos, to pricier seasonal specials.  Italian menu - pastas, seafood, gelato, kid's menu.
Close-seating, happening vibe.  Outside seating available.
And weekend brunch is fun and yummy as well.

data.title: Dinner with Friends
data.text: Went there for dinner from out of town  and wasn't really impressed. Also wait staff seemed to rush us and were not very friendly.  I'll go elsewhere when I'm back in the area.

data.title: Date night with wife
data.text: My wife and I go out every Friday night for date night.  This was first timeline chose Strizzi's.  It was quite good.  Their half menu entree with salad, soup, etc. was quite nice.  Reasonably priced and plenty to eat.  Then again, if you are the buffet type and type that you need loads of food, you will be disappointed.  The food was portioned right for us and comparable with price.  Quality was good.  Good taste.  Wine is also reasonably priced.  Will go back to either Pleasanton or Livermore.

data.title: Dinning Around in Pleasanton California
data.text: I am known to patronize Strizzi's on a weekly basis and my wife and I have never been disappointed.  The salmon is to die for and June is coming up so take note that Copper River will be here.  All the pasta dishes are done to perfection.  The location is a little noisy so if the weather is nice take a table outside and enjoy watching all the people that stroll by and look envious at what you are consuming.

data.title: Accommodating & Very Friendly
data.text: My 2 grand children (ages 8-9) had a late lunch break at this restaurant. Since we are all vegetarians, we asked for spaghetti without the meat balls and they had no problem accommodating us.  The food was delicious, the restaurant was clean and comfortable, and we enjoyed the many historic pictures. The waitress was very helpful and friendly.

data.title: Tasty Italian food in a nice setting
data.text: There are a lot of Italian restaurants in Pleasanton but this one caught our eye as we were strolling down the street looking for a dinner spot. We are very glad we ate here. The food was well prepared and well served.  The waitstaff was attentive and friendly. The ambience was comfortable.

data.title: Reset our standard of excellence for Italian restaurants!
data.text:
We enjoyed a late lunch/early dinner on a warm afternoon, sitting outside.  We ordered 2 appetizers, the Mozzarella/Tomato salad and the Artichoke dip.  Both excellent.  Mr. ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, I had the Combination Special - you get to choose one of 3 salads or 2 soups, and choose an appetizer-sized entree.  I had their house salad, excellent, with real bacon pieces.  My order of Seafood Fettuccine Alfredo was perfectly prepared, and just the right size with 2 large scallops and 2 medium sized shrimp.  The sauce rivaled the one I had in Little Italy, New York City.  With our meals, appetizers and 2 glasses of wine, we were out of there for less than $60, which I think is pretty good.  Not something we'd do every week, but an excellent value for a special meal.

Our server, Patty, was excellent, friendly and took the time to get to know us a bit.  We plan to return with my sis and her hubby before we leave the area in the next week.

Highly recommend if you are in the area.  The whole downtown area there looks like a great place to spend a day, 

Bravo!!!

data.title: You can't go wrong!!
data.text: Strizzis continues to be our go to restaurant in Pleasanton.  Weather going out on a date or having dinner as a family, we are never disappointed. The food is consistently amazing, the service is outstanding. And the price is great. I highly recommend it !!

data.title: A great Friday night dinner right on Main Street!
data.text: We met friends for dinner. The selection was outstanding. There were traditional menu items coupled with nightly specials. The food was outstanding!  The service was excellent!  The quality of food was exceptional!  We love this place and...we shall return!

data.title: Lunch outside downtown
data.text: We have found ourselves in the downtown area of Pleasanton around lunch time quite a few times lately.  We always try somewhere new.....and so far everywhere has been a very nice experience.  Strizzi's is no exception.  We3 sat outside and enjoy the nice weather.  Our waitress and all of the staff were super friendly.  And of course our lunch was very good.  They have a special...choose a salad & a pasta dish for $13.99.  We had a Caesar & Spinach salad......my spinach salad was the better choice.  Then we had the fettuccine alfredo & pesto chicken...both very good also.

data.title: Lovely pasta dinner
data.text: There were 3 of us at dinner on Sunday, Jan 17. We decided to go family-style so we we shared the Bruchetta, Three Berry Salad, Rigatoni Bolognese, and Cajun Chicken Risotto.  All were delicious - especially the salad and the Rigatoni.  Service was great and very friendly. Looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: Only if you have to . . .
data.text: My wife and I ate at Strizzi's this past Sunday afternoon. The server failed to mention that the "chalkboard specials" were all sold out until we each ordered one. Since we had already ordered drinks, we decided to stay and selected different main courses. The Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo was bland and the pasta was under cooked. The Rigatoni Bolognese had the same problems. Except for the expresso at the end of the meal, there wasn't much reason to return to this restaurant. There are much better places in Pleasanton.

data.title: Good place with a good location
data.text: This place we found to have really good food but possibly a limited menu depending upon your taste. If you like salmon and other common fish pasta you will probably love this place as they do the food well. It is in central downtown Pleasanton right on Main Street. I myself enjoyed the food my wife not so much.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
Strizzi's offers both inside and outside dining. When the restaurant is near capacity, it is very loud and hard to hear individuals in your party. In those cases, I suggest outdoor dining. 

The food is very good with several nightly specials. Very nice wine list. 

Service has always been very good.
